cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi south of Morgan City, Louisiana (or 120 mi WSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River)
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly turning northwest tonight, then northward on Saturday–Sunday, moving inland through south-central Louisiana toward the lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City / south-central Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle; Intracoastal City to Cameron (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lake Pontchartrain & Maurepas, Intracoastal City to Cameron (T.S. Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from Intracoastal City eastward past the Mississippi River Delta to Biloxi, including Plaquemines Parish
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–50 kt) with occasional hurricane-force gusts possible late Friday night through Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–6 ft above ground possible along Plaquemines Parish’s Mississippi River delta and adjacent bays
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–20 inches with locally higher totals up to 25 inches, producing life-threatening flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in squalls and dangerous river/overland flooding that could disrupt port access roads
